subject: Re: [junit] Instantiated TestCase won't run tests
msgSnippet: ... While I appreciate the energy you put into answering questions here, I often wonder what might happen if you didn t have the energy.  Perhaps by letting
messageBody:
On Dec 21, 2004, at 7:38 AM, J. B. Rainsberger wrote:

>> Rather than deem Junit insufficient, my first thought was that I was
>> missing
>> something. This stance was taken out of respect for “all the very
>> smart
>> people who've been working with JUnit since 1999.” The reason that I
>> asked on this
>> forum is to “take some stock in what someone with experience has to
>> say.”
>> I was expecting some explanation of why this type of testing was not
>> supported.
>
> OK. Did you get the explanation you wanted? Sometimes the explanation
> takes pages and pages, and I don't have the energy to write that out
> every time someone asks.

While I appreciate the energy you put into answering questions here, I
often wonder what might happen if you didn't have the energy. Perhaps
by letting questions linger a bit longer, the collective energy of the
community would kick in so that you didn't feel like you had to answer
every question.

That being said, I must admit that I'm truly lost on this thread. I'd
like to help, but the question being asked isn't clear to me. Could
someone please restated it as plainly as possible, with example code if
applicable? I'll do my best to offer advice.

Mike
